A05002-d-06-13-05-WTJR.Reporting Railroad Name: WICHITA, TILLMAN & JACKSON RAILWAY COMPANY, INC.
A05002-d-06-13-05-WTJR.Maintenance Railroad Name: WICHITA, TILLMAN & JACKSON RAILWAY COMPANY, INC.
A05002-d-06-13-05-WTJR.Primary Accident Cause: Interaction of lateral/vertical forces (includes harmonic rock off)
A05002-d-06-13-05-WTJR.Accident Cause: Interaction of lateral/vertical forces (includes harmonic rock off)
A05002-d-06-13-05-WTJR.Narrative: ON JUNE 13, 2005, AT APPROXIMATELY 15:30 THE WTJ 4443-WTJ4454 WERE IN THE PROCESS OF SHOVING 25 LOADED RAIL CARS WEST INTO THE GRANDFIELD SIDING WHEN THE 4TH & 5TH CARS IN THE CONSIST DERAILED.  OPERATING MANAGER INSPECTED AND FOUND THE 4TH & 5TH CARS HAD BOTH TRUCKS DERAILED AND THE WEST #1 WHEEL ON THE NORTH SIDE OF THE 6TH CAR WAS SITTING ON THE WEB OF THE RAIL.  THE LENGTH OF THE DERAILMENT WAS APPROXIMATELY 150`.  WHEN THE 4TH CAR ENTERED THE CURVE OF THE SIDING IT ROLLED THE NORTH RAIL OVER ALLOWING THE WHEELS ON THE NORTH SIDE TO ROLL IN THE WEB OF THE RAIL. THE WHEELS ON THE SOUTH SIDEOF THE CARS WENT ON THE GROUND NEXT TO THE RAIL.  THE WHEELS ON THE WEST TRUCK OF THE 4TH CAR WERENEW WITH GOOD FLANGES AND THE CAR HAD ROLLER TYPE BEARINGS.  THE CROSSTIE CONDITION IN THE SIDING WAS FAIR, THEREFORE, WE CONCLUDE THAT THE LATERAL FORCE OF THE CAR CAUSED THE RAIL TO ROLL WHICH, IN TURN, CAUSED THE DERAILMENT
A05002-d-06-13-05-WTJR.Reporting Parent Railroad Company Name: WICHITA, TILLMAN & JACKSON RAILWAY COMPANY, INC.

IR05341-d-06-10-05-CFE.Narrative: CREW SWITCHING BUNGE CORPORATION. CONDUCTOR PICKED UP FROM #4 TRACK AND DOUBLED TO 3C.  HE THEN PROTECTED THE SHOVE UNDER 2ND STREET SHOVING DOWN TO PICK UP MORE CARS.  HE STATES HE WALKED THE LADDERLINING SWITCHES AS HE WALKED, HE SAYS HE RECEIVED A CALL FROM BUNGE RELEASING MORE CARS.  HE THEN STATES HE LOOKED DOWN THE TRACK AND SAW THE CARS AND DECIDED TO CHANGE HIS MOVES TO PICKING UP FOUR CARS FROM RUNAROUND TRACK AND THEN DOUBLE TO THE LARGER CUT OF CARS FROM #1 LADDER.  HE WALKED BY SEVERAL SWITCHES MAKING SURE THEY WERE LINED PROPER.  THE SWITCH IN QUESTION HE THINKS HE LINED PROPER BUT AFTER THINKING ABOUT IT HE FEELS HE MAY HAVE LINED IT AGAINST HIMSELF AND KEPT ON WALKING THINKING ABOUT THE CHANGE IN PICKING UP THAT OCCURED.  HE THEN TOLD THE ENGINEER TO BACK UP MAKING A TIE ONTHE FOUR CARS AND THEN TOLD THE ENGINEER TO DRAG THEM OUT TO PICK UP THE REST OF THEM, WHEN THEY WENT BACK SOUTH THROUGH THE RUN THROUGH SWITCH THEY DERAILED THE THREE CARS.

2005060701-d-06-07-05-UCRY.Narrative: TRAIN #17 PULLED A CUT OF 11 LOADED CARS OUT OF TRANSFER TRACK AND PROCEEDED SOUTHBOUND ON THE MAINTRACK APPROACHING THE CROSSOVER TO TRACK #98.  THE ENGINEER NOTICED AT APPROX. 20 FEET FROM THE CROSSOVER THAT IT WAS LINED FOR THE CROSSOVER MOVEMENT.  THE ENGINEER APPLIED THE BRAKES AND THE MOVEMENT PROCEEDING ON THE CROSSOVER AND SIDE SWIPED TWO EMPTY TANK CARS LOCATED ON SIDING TRACK #98 DERAILING THE A-END ON CAR ACFX 95125 AND THE B-END ON CAR ACFX 95126 AND DAMAGING LOCOMOTIVE UP 725.  THECAUSE OF THIS INCIDENT WAS VANDALISM, THE TARGET HAD BEEN REMOVED, AND THE POINTS THAT HAD BEEN SPIKED FOR THE MAIN LINE MOVEMENT HAD BEEN REMOVED AND THE SWITCH LINED FOR THE CROSSOVER.  THREE MINORBOYS HAVE BEEN TAKEN INTO CUSTODY AND CHARGED FOR THE CRIME BY THE WEBER COUNTY SHERIFF, LOCATED INOGDEN, UTAH.  CASE #WC 2005-23607.

2005188-d-06-29-05-ICE.Narrative: RUN #57 (ICE CREW) WAS SWITCHING ON THE WEST LEAD AT KNOCHE YARD WHEN EMPLOYEE LET 9 LOADS DRIFT INTO #5 RAIL.  #5 RAIL HAD 38 CARS IN IT ALL ON THE EAST END WITH THREE HAND BRAKES TIED ON THE EAST END.  THE 9 CARS ROLLED APPROXIMATELY 700 TO 800 FEET DOWN INTO THE RAIL AND STRUCK THE 38 STANDING CARS WHICH CAUSED THEM TO ROLL OUT AND INTO THE SIDE OF THE 13TH CAR OF A CUT THAT RUN #42 (KCS CREW)WAS WORKING CAUSING DAMAGE TO THAT TANK AND THE STRIKING CAR IN #5 RAIL.  CREW WAS DRUG/ALCOHOL TESTED WITH NEGATIVE RESULTS.  NO INJURIES.
